titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8347

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 12 April 1862.

Hon:
Nat Gaither
Sec: of State
Sir

Lieut: James W. Woodward has been promoted (date of Com: 14 Nov 1861) Solomon (alias Samuel Bottoms has been Promoted (date of Com: 14 Novr 1861) Lieut: J W Tydings has been promoted (date of Com: 20 Nov/ '61) Lieut: John B. Riggs deserted (date of Com 3 feb/ '62) Asst Surg: David P. Middleton resigned (date of Com: 13 Decr 1861) Chaplain Matthew N. Lasley resigned (date of Com: 13 Dec/ '61) Lieut: William H. Sneed resigned (date of Com: 2d Decr 1861)_

I send Ten Comms: for record &c
(over)
1862 Ap: 9- G. S. Nunn 2d Lieut: #1
"- H. F. Temple 2d -- #2
1861 Dec 4- Gran B McGee 2 -- #3
1862 Feb 6- Wm K Irwin 2 -- #4
Mar 13_ E. P. Allen- 2 -- #5
"- Sam Bottoms 1 -- #6
"- James W. Woodward Capt #7
12- Gann M Smith Qr Mas -- #8
Jan 12- John A. Lindsey Asst Surg #9
Mar 28_ Harvey R Wolfe Qr Mas #10

Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
